I've been looking around for popular mechanisms for encrypting message 
bodies.  multipart/encrypted and multipart/signed seemed like a general 
widely used (or not?) format for encryption/signing.

My question is, wasn't Content-Encoding designed for this very thing? 
Wouldn't it make more sense to have:

POST /somewhere
Content-Type: application/xml
Content-Encoding: encrypted; key=...
